o
Xoo
R Creatures can't block this turn unless their controller pays o
X for each blocking creature.

rulings.text: The ability only applies to blocks declared after it resolves. It will not add costs to any blockers already announced.

You can choose X=0. This doesn’t have an effect most of the time, but it does mean that creatures can’t block unless the controller chooses to pay the cost (a cost of zero is not automatically paid). You can use this to make your creatures unable to block an attacker.

mainBoard.text: {X}{R}: This turn, creatures can't block unless their controller pays {X} for each blocking creature they control.

mainBoard.name: Invigorate
mainBoard.originalText:
If you control a forest, you may have an opponent gain 3 life instead of paying Invigorate's mana cost.
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If an effect says that an opponent can't gain life, you can't have that player gain life to pay Invigorate's alternative cost. If an effect instead replaces life gain, such as that of Sulfuric Vortex, you may choose to pay the cost even though the cost's action is replaced with nothing.

To determine the total cost of a spell, start with the mana cost or alternative cost you're paying (such as the alternative cost of Invigorate), add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. The mana value of the spell remains unchanged, no matter what the total cost to cast it was.

mainBoard.text:

rulings.text: Your lands are tapped as part of the effect, not part of the cost.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.
